items.title: How grocery giants control who can sell food in your neighbourhood: CBC's Marketplace cheat sheet
items.summary_auto: The CBC's Marketplace rounds up the consumer and health news you need from the week.

items.title: N.L. turns down the lights as progress made on downed hydro station
items.summary_auto: In the face of possible rotating power outages, residents are doing their best to conserve power as N.L. Hydro crews work to restore service at Bay d'Espoir plant choked with ice.

items.title: As U.S. moves ships toward Iran, Revolutionary Guard commander warns his force has its ‘finger on the trigger’
items.summary_auto: Nournews, a news outlet close to Iran’s Supreme National Security Council, reported on its Telegram channel that the commander, Gen. Mohammad Pakpour, warned the United States and Israel "to avoid any miscalculation."

items.title: New Netflix series about a hockey team's bus crash hits a nerve in Sask.
items.summary_auto: A new Netflix hockey series is in production, set in a working-class town where hockey is everything until a bus crash kills players and their coach. The similarity to the Humboldt Broncos' tragedy is raising eyebrows in their home province.

items.title: Dingoes that circled Piper James's body on Australian beach to be culled
items.summary_auto: In an online statement, a spokesperson from the government's Ministry of Environment and Tourism said it was aware of initial autopsy findings suggesting dingo bites were likely not James's immediate cause of death.

items.title: Parks Canada shuttering Historic Places website, sparking heritage concerns
items.summary_auto: Parks Canada says it will deactivate the Canadian Register of Historic Places website this spring, leaving no alternative database to look up Nova Scotia heritage sites in one location.

items.title: A Canada-run alternative to Nexus? Senator calls for new airport security fast-pass
items.summary_auto: With Canadian travel to the United States in decline, one Alberta senator says it's time for Ottawa to consider a Canadian-specific program that would allow travellers to quickly pass through airport security lines.

items.title: Princess Charlotte showing more confidence in public appearances
items.summary_auto: As Princess Charlotte steps out in public with her family, the 10-year-old daughter of the Prince and Princess of Wales is starting to show increasing signs of independence and confidence.

items.title: Canada's wildfire paradox: fewer fires, greater destruction highlighted in new analysis
items.summary_auto: A new national analysis finds Canada is seeing fewer wildfires overall, but a growing share of damage is being driven by a smaller number of increasingly large, hard-to-control fires.

items.title: Climber Alex Honnold completes rope-free ascent of Taipei 101 skyscraper
items.summary_auto: The climb drew both excitement and concern over the ethical implications of attempting such a high-risk endeavor on live broadcast.
